question: [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Sampling State] Does the SampleRate::Duration mechanism maintain per-thread or global state, and can attackers exploit thread scheduling to bypass sampling on specific threads? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Status Extraction] Can info.status().as_u16() at line 18 produce incorrect values if the HTTP status is malformed, causing misclassification of errors? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Edge Case] Does the status field properly handle non-standard HTTP status codes (e.g., 999, 600) that could bypass the >= 500 check at line 32? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [HttpRequestLog struct] [Integer Size] Is the u16 status field at line 47 sufficient for all possible status values, or can overflow occur in edge cases? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [IP Spoofing] Does the remote_addr field at line 20 capture the actual client IP or can it be spoofed via proxies, leading to incorrect attribution of malicious requests? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Privacy Violation] Does logging Option<std::net::SocketAddr> at line 44 expose PII (client IPs) without consent, potentially violating GDPR or privacy regulations for Aptos API users? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [IPv6 Handling] Does the SocketAddr logging properly handle IPv6 addresses including edge cases like IPv4-mapped IPv6 addresses that could bypass IP filtering? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Timing Attack] Can the elapsed Duration field at line 26 leak timing information about internal processing, enabling timing-based side-channel attacks on consensus operations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [HttpRequestLog struct] [Schema Annotation] Does the #[schema(debug)] annotation at line 50 properly format Duration, or can extremely long durations cause formatting issues? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Clock Skew] Can system clock manipulation affect the elapsed time calculation, causing negative or extremely large Duration values to be logged? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Race Condition] Does the custom logger function at line 17 have any shared mutable state that could cause race conditions when handling concurrent HTTP requests? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Thread Safety] Is the move closure at line 17 thread-safe when copied across threads, or can concurrent invocations cause data races in the logging subsystem? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [HttpRequestLog struct] [Lifetime Safety] Can the 'a lifetime in HttpRequestLog cause use-after-free if request data is freed before logging completes in high-concurrency scenarios? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Copy Trait] Does the Copy trait requirement at line 16 (impl Fn(Info) + Copy) prevent capturing any state that could cause memory safety issues? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Panic Safety] If debug! or error! macros at lines 33-35 panic, can this crash the entire webserver thread, causing API unavailability? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Silent Failure] Does the .ok() call at line 30 silently drop FORWARDED header parsing errors, hiding potentially malicious header manipulation attempts? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Error Propagation] Are errors in to_string() conversions (lines 21-22) properly handled, or can allocation failures cause panics? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [HttpRequestLog struct] [Schema Macro] Can the #[derive(Schema)] macro at line 41 cause code generation issues that introduce security vulnerabilities? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [HttpRequestLog struct] [Display Annotation] Does the #[schema(display)] annotation at line 43 properly escape special characters when formatting remote_addr? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [HttpRequestLog struct] [Debug Annotation] Can the #[schema(debug)] annotation at line 50 cause information leakage by exposing internal Duration representation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [HttpRequestLog struct] [String Allocation] Do the String fields (method, path) at lines 45-46 allocate unbounded memory for large inputs, enabling memory exhaustion attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Memory Leak] Can repeated logging of large HttpRequestLog structs cause memory leaks if the logger backend cannot keep up with log volume? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Stack Overflow] Does constructing HttpRequestLog at lines 19-31 allocate on the stack, and can extremely large headers cause stack overflow? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [HttpRequestLog struct] [Drop Implementation] Is there a custom Drop implementation that could fail, leaking resources or causing panics during cleanup? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Warp Dependency] Can vulnerabilities in warp::log::Info or warp::log::custom() be exploited through this logging wrapper? (Medium)
